key_channel_insights.line_content: 98.89% of route listings on OTAs were priced above the carrier website last week, reflecting a consistent channel markup.
MSE matched website fares for 99.6% of itineraries with just 0.4% missing offers, underscoring robust parity.
GDS listings covered 99.90% of itineraries with fares averaging +0.52% above web prices, indicating stable channel premiums.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Last week 98.89% of route listings on OTA were priced above the website, indicating a consistent channel markup.
The OTA channel maintained an average price premium of 0.63% over the carrier site, unchanged week-over-week.
Approximately 1.11% of ODs had no OTA listing last week, a slight uptick from 0.88% in the prior week.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 98.89% of fares were higher on OTA last week, a 0.23 pp decrease from the week before with an average markup of 0.63%.
1.11% of ODs lacked OTA offers last week, up 0.23 pp week-over-week and down 0.09 pp month-over-month.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes posted a 98.89% OTA-higher rate with a 0.63% average premium, edging down 0.23 pp week-over-week.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Routes originating in Ethiopia showed the same 98.89% OTA-higher frequency and 0.63% markup, with a 1.11% availability gap.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings had 98.86% of fares higher on OTA (down 0.06 pp) and a 0.63% average premium; 1.14% of itineraries were unavailable.
Far-out bookings recorded 98.94% OTA-higher pricing (down 0.52 pp) with a 0.62% markup and a 1.06% listing gap.

mse_highlights.line_content: Last week 0.4% of itineraries were not found on the MSE channel versus 0% a month ago, signaling a slight distribution gap.
MSE matched website fares for 99.6% of itineraries, underscoring strong parity across routes.
Far-out bookings saw a 1.06% missing-offer rate versus 0% for close-in, highlighting longer-horizon coverage risk.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Missing offers on MSE rose to 0.4% of itineraries in the latest week, up from zero a month ago.
99.6% of itineraries displayed identical pricing on MSE, down 0.4 percentage points versus the prior week and month.
There were no instances of MSE fares below the carrier website last week.
There were no instances of MSE fares above the carrier website last week.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes mirrored the aggregate, with 0.4% missing offers and 99.6% price parity on MSE.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: All origin markets showed the same pattern of 0.4% missing offers and 99.6% parity, matching overall channel performance.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in itineraries achieved 100% price parity and had zero missing offers on MSE.
Far-out itineraries experienced a 1.06% missing-offer rate and 98.94% parity, down 1.06 points from the previous month.

gds_highlights.line_content: Average GDS fares ran 0.52% above web prices last week, aligning closely with +0.53% week-over-week and +0.54% month-over-month trends.
GDS listings covered 99.90% of itineraries last week, halving website-only gaps MoM from 0.60% to 0.10%.
GDS price premiums were uniform across segments and booking windows, ranging narrowly between +0.51% and +0.52%.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 99.90% of itineraries were priced higher on GDS last week, a slight dip from 100% the prior week and 99.40% the previous month.
Only 0.10% of itineraries were unavailable on GDS last week, down 0.50 percentage points MoM.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul itineraries saw 99.90% priced higher on GDS last week—down marginally from 100% WoW—while the average premium held at +0.52%.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: ET origin group posted 99.90% of itineraries at higher GDS fares last week, maintaining the +0.52% average premium versus the website.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 99.84% of close-in bookings had higher GDS fares last week, down from 100% WoW, with a steady +0.52% price gap.
Far-out itineraries achieved 100% GDS availability last week—up from 98.64% MoM—with fares +0.51% above the website.
